title: Problemi con la sincronizzazione Firefox: cronologia e attivitÃ  recenti
content:
Ciao, ho problemi con la sincornizzazione del mio Firefox. E' installato su sistema operativo Ubuntu 24.04.3 LTS. Quando apro il browser sono costretto ad andare nelle impostazioni, gestione sincronizzazione, sconnettere e riconnettere la sincronizzazione. Dopo avere effettuato la manovra appare la intera cronologia e le attivitÃ  recenti nella prima pagina. Diversamente nulla. Oppure occorre aspettare parecchio tempo. Se chiudo il browser e lo riapro subito dopo, il problema si manifesta di nuovo. Avevo provato se non ricordo male a disconnettere l'account ed a riconnetterlo ma il problema permaneva.

Spero possiate aiutarami, grazie

title: firefox deb unattended-upgrades on ubuntu 24.04
content:
I installed firefox on ubuntu 24.04 following the guidelines from https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/install-firefox-linux

I followed the direction from the section "Install Firefox .deb package for Debian-based distributions", adding the https://packages.mozilla.org/apt repository, prioritizing that over firefox snap from ubunto repors and finally installing firefox.

All good, now I have the latest firefox.

Question: what entry should I add to the "Unattended-Upgrade::Allowed-Origins" section of "/etc/apt/apt.conf.d/50unattended-upgrades" in order to enable unattended upgrades for the mozilla repo?

Googling this got me different contradictory recommendations that did not get my system to firefox 146 until I manually run the apt update/upgrade.

Thanks!

title: Youtube stops working when Wine/Proton are running (Linux, Flathub)
content:
First noticed when listening to music on YouTube while playing a game: After a few songs, video would stop, shortly followed by audio (Every few minutes it might play less than a second of audio). Somewhere along the line any interaction with YT itself or even the tab stop working. All other tabs work fine.

Firefox doesn't ever crash, and I can't see anything weird when using a process viewer (I'm not too familiar with Linux diagnostic tools).

So far I've tried:

  • Updating Firefox
  • Disabling Extensions
  • Clearing cache
  • Uninstall Firefox
  • Multiple Proton games through Steam
  • Game running through Wine
  • Updated OS

I've tested with Chrome, which had no issues.

I don't recall messing with anything at the time (I did change some settings in firefox, but I think that was a few days before the issue started).

--System-- Operating System: Bazzite 43 KDE Plasma Version: 6.5.3 KDE Frameworks Version: 6.20.0 Qt Version: 6.10.1 Kernel Version: 6.17.7-ba20.fc43.x86_64 (64-bit) Graphics Platform: Wayland Processors: 16 Ã— AMD Ryzen 7 9700X 8-Core Processor Memory: 32 GiB of RAM (30.5 GiB usable) Graphics Processor 1: NVIDIA GeForce RTX 4070 Graphics Processor 2: AMD Ryzen 7 9700X 8-Core Processor Manufacturer: Gigabyte Technology Co., Ltd. Product Name: B650 EAGLE AX System Version: Default string-CF

title: Reduction de la taille de la fenetre a chaque demarrage
content:
Bonjour,

A chaque demarrage de firefox, la taille des fenetres retaurees se reduit. L'environnement est du KDE Plasma X11 sur une Debian 12. La methode est simple: Ouvrir firefox. (Mode restauration de la session precedente active) Quitter firefox. Reouvrir firefox. La fenetre se reduit a la retauration des pages.

Comment remedier a cela? J'ai deja tenter avec un nouveau profil. Le probleme persiste.

Cordialement.

title: Bing homepage on Firefox
content:
I'm sorry to be asking this question again, but my previous thread was locked without my being given an opportunity to respond. The question was this:

I have Bing as my homepage, but on one computer I have a very annoying problem. I click on the settings to turn off 'Show news and interests' and 'Show trending on Bing', but the next time I come back to the homepage these settings have turned themselves back on. What do I have to do to retain these settings?

Denys responded to say it was a feature introduced by an extension. I'm not sure what gave this impression; I'm simply going to the Bing homepage (www.bing.com). I do have extensions installed, but I have turned them all off for this page just in case it was one of these that was causing the issue. If you click on the hamburger menu at the top right of this page you have an option to disable 'Show trending' and 'Show news etc', but as soon as the page is refreshed the news and trending, which appear at the bottom of the page, reappear. It's as if Firefox isn't saving the cookies, and yet it clearly is.

title: NOAA Animation Loops Not Working
content:
I'm running FF on Windows v145.0.1 and navigate to... 

    https://www.star.nesdis.noaa.gov/goes/conus_band.php?sat=G18&band=GEOCOLOR&length=24

...and the animation doesn't work. This is a recent phenomenon. I have another computer in the office I've turned off FF updates (obvious reasons) and the animation works fine. It worked on my computer until recently. I'm so exhausted with FF updates that break things, it's getting as bad as Windows. I've run FF in troubleshoot mode, no good. I've added this primary domain to exceptions to enhanced tracking, no good. Nothing works so I assume it's Firefox (may not be). But v129.0.2 works fine, in this respect (streaming the animation loops of GOES West).

Does anyone know what configuration or setting I can explore to make this work again?  :-(

Thanks,
creator: BPaul_H

title: How to add all tabs to bookmarks in Android?
content:
Hello. I haven't been able to find anything of the sort on my own, so i fear maybe there is no actual way other than doing it one by one. But, is there a way to add all of my currently open tabs in firefox android app, to my bookmarks (or collections, maybe), instead of having to select them one by one? Or, in its defect, a way to select all tabs, given that there seems to be no button to quickly select all currently open tabs? At this point, if anyone knows a firefox extension/add-on that works on mobile that could do that, i would deeply appreciate it.

Thanks in advance, i just want a way to not have to select my 100+ open tabs by hand since it genuinely seems like a waste of effort for me and i would rather spend that energy into migrating to another browser altoghether.
